result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Gallert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $250.00 to Alfred & Jenny G.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, restitution, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

No possession of weapons or body armor.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Cooperate with probation department.
No voting until his civil rights are restored.
Provide a DNA sample, if one has not been provided.

Continue with AODA treatment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Kevin M Gallert in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 3 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervison:
- 60 days condition time with good time credit/ Huber for work and treatment.  STRAIGHT TIME.  Court stayed commencement until 9/15/2015
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- no possession of weapons or body armour
- no voting until his civil rights are restored
- 50 hours of community service
- Continue with AODA treatment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment
- Provide a DNA sample. if one has not been provided

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $250.00 to Alfred & Jenny G; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing Referral Form
dated 9/1/2015 from qAM, received and filed

Defendant Kevin M Gallert in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights,  Addendum and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Signed INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE & ACKNOWLEDGMENT provided to defendant.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin M Gallert in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin M Gallert in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin M Gallert in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 08:30 am.
